javanews.object.table
Class LinkTable

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
      javanews.object.table.GenericTable
          javanews.object.table.LinkTable
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.table.TableModel
public class LinkTable
extends GenericTable

This class is used to represent links on codexes. The class is designed to hold basic information such as the pse, link id, status and the date the last change was received. This class is used by the COMPortClient class to store information about existing links (those already in the database) and new links (those discovered by the application). As each COMPortClient instance is related to a specific COM port there should always be double the number of instances of this class than COMPortClient windows open on-screen.

Version:
1.000
Author:
Alex Harris (email: Alexander.J.Harris(at)btinternet.com)
See Also:

Method Detail

addLink

public void addLink(java.lang.String pse,
                    java.lang.String link,
                    java.lang.Integer state)
This method can be used to add new link information to the link hashtable. As the hashtable overwrites existing entries it can also be used to update the hashtable.

Parameters:
pse - The pse name
link - The link id within the named pse
state - The current state of the named link

setLinkState

public void setLinkState(java.lang.String pse,
                         java.lang.String link,
                         java.lang.Integer state)
This is a convinience method for setting a link state. It actually calls the addLink method.

Parameters:
pse - The pse name
link - The link id within the named pse
state - The current state of the named link
See Also:
addLink(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.Integer)

getLinkState

public java.lang.Integer getLinkState(java.lang.String pse,
                                      java.lang.String link)
Returns the state of a given link within a given pse. States are:
  • 0 - Link down
  • 1 - Link up
  • 2 - Link state unknown

Parameters:
pse - The name of the PSE
link - The name of the link within the named PSE
Returns:
The state of the link or -1 for not found.

getUpdatedDate

public java.util.Calendar getUpdatedDate(java.lang.String pse,
                                         java.lang.String link)
Returns the date the status of the link was last changed.

Parameters:
pse - The name of the PSE
link - The name of the link within the named PSE
Returns:
The date and time of the last status update on the link

getPSENames

public java.util.NavigableSet getPSENames()
Returns all of the PSE names contained within the table as an instance of NavigableSet

Returns:
The names of all the known PSEs
See Also:
NavigableSet

getLinkNames

public java.util.NavigableSet getLinkNames(java.lang.String pse)
Returns all of the link names contained within the table given a PSE as an instance of NavigableSet

Parameters:
pse - The PSE name to be used
Returns:
The names of all the known links under a PSE
See Also:
NavigableSet

getInitialFigures

public java.util.Hashtable getInitialFigures()
Returns the stats of the links within the table. The Hashtable should only contain three keys with integer values of the number of links in each of those states. These states are:
  • up - The number of links in an up state
  • down - The number of links in a down state
  • unknown - The number of links in an unknown state

Returns:
The figures of links in each state
See Also:
Hashtable

decrementStats

public void decrementStats(int state)
Decrements the counter of the given state by one.

Parameters:
state - The state to decrement:
  • 0 - Link down
  • 1 - Link up
  • 2 - Link state unknown

incrementStats

public void incrementStats(int state)
Increments the counter of the given state by one.

Parameters:
state - The state to increment:
  • 0 - Link down
  • 1 - Link up
  • 2 - Link state unknown
